articles.author: Andrew Gray, Sarah Marsh
articles.description: The European Commission said on Monday it was putting all of its development aid for Palestinians, worth 691 million euros ($729 million), under review and immediately suspending all payments following Hamas' attack on Israel.
articles.title: EU freezes development aid to Palestinians after Hamas attack

articles.author: Daniel Trotta
articles.description: Prominent Harvard University alumni on Monday denounced a pro-Palestinian statement from students that blamed Israel for violence engulfing the region and urged the university to take action against the signatories.
articles.title: Pro-Palestinian letter from Harvard students provokes alumni outrage

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United Nations humanitarian office said on Tuesday that nearly 200,000 people or nearly a tenth of the population, have fled their homes in Gaza since the start of hostilities and is poised for shortages of water and electricity due to a blockade.
articles.title: UN says nearly 200,000 displaced in Gaza, water shortages expected

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tehran was not involved in the militant Hamas group's weekend attack on Israel, Iran's top authority Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said on Tuesday, but hailed what he called Israel's "irreparable" military and intelligence defeat.
articles.title: Iran's Khamenei says Tehran was not behind Hamas attack on Israel

articles.author: Napat Wesshasartar, Chayut Setboonsarng
articles.description: When 26-year-old Natthaporn Onkaew headed for Israel two years ago to join thousands of fellow Thai migrants and take a job as a farm worker, his father warned him not to go.
articles.title: Distraught parents of Thai seized in Israel plead: 'help the hostages'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel would on Tuesday begin distributing thousands of assault rifles to volunteer first-response teams in border communities and mixed Jewish-Arab towns, National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir said in a social media post.
articles.title: Israel arming volunteer guards in border communities, Jewish-Arab towns

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Several global companies have temporarily shut some operations in Israel and asked employees to work from home as the country goes on war footing in response to a surprise attack by the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas over the weekend.
articles.title: What are global firms with presence in Israel doing after Hamas attack

articles.author: Emily Rose, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Islamist militant Hamas movement threatened to execute an Israeli captive every time Israel bombs a Palestinian home without warning, as Israel called up an unprecedented 300,000 reservists and imposed a blockade on the Gaza Strip, raising fears it planned a ground assault.
articles.title: Hamas threatens to kill captives if Israel strikes civilians

articles.author: James Pomfret, Joe Cash, Chen Lin
articles.description: When China announced a surprise deal restoring ties between Saudi Arabia and Iran this year, it signalled Beijing's desire to be a diplomatic heavyweight in the Middle East.
articles.title: Analysis: Middle East crisis test limits of China's diplomatic push

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan
articles.title: Morning Bid: 'Remarkable' US markets surf crosscurrents
